resource.title: SYSTMS Transition Workflow
resource.description: A ComfyUI workflow for creating smooth video transitions between two different clips using WAN 2.2 VACE
resource.creator: ingi // SYSTMS

requirements: High VRAM (80GB+ recommended for full quality)
Videos with common elements (person, color, shape) work best
recommended_settings: Shift value of 8 (sweet spot for transitions)
49 frames total with 11 frame overlap for basic transitions
81 frames with 14 frame overlap for elaborate transitions
Lower shift values (5 and below) for forcing transitions but may cause hard cuts
Higher shift values (above 9) may lead to cross fades
Adding CFG without Lightning for first step can help force transitions
tips: Pick shots that work well together for best results
Describe what's in frame before, during, and after transition in prompts
Focus on scene descriptions rather than just transition effects
Longer overlaps help with more complex transitions
Can experiment with no prompts for unexpected results
usage.workflow_notes: Process videos two at a time (1+2, 2+3, 3+4), then combine in After Effects with frame trimming or fading

technical_details: Uses fp16 to bf16 automatic conversion in Kijai's code
Math node calculates frame skipping for proper overlap
VACE can handle 400+ frames with context options
BF16 VACE provides slightly more motion than FP16
Memory management differs between wrapper nodes and native nodes

issues_and_solutions.solution: Make overlaps longer so model has more reference material
Adjust shift values, improve prompting with detailed scene descriptions, add CFG for first frame

issues_and_solutions.issue: Start index out of range error
issues_and_solutions.solution: Check that overlap setting doesn't exceed clip length - math node may be trying to skip more frames than available
Avoid using identical start/end frames - give VACE different time points to interpolate between
Use WAN 2.1 1_3B models, FP8 versions with matching precision, aggressive block swapping (30+ blocks), or lower resolution (360x480)

issues_and_solutions.issue: Time jumps near end of output
issues_and_solutions.solution: Check for duplicate overlapping frames in input

summary: A comprehensive workflow for creating smooth video transitions using WAN 2.2 VACE, with detailed community discussion covering optimization tips, memory management, and troubleshooting. The workflow can also be adapted for frame interpolation and slow-motion effects.
